intro: Stenomesson viridiflorum, commonly known as the greenflower stenomesson, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in arid to semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Stenomesson viridiflorum is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
